text:
Afiak, the process can’t be aborted unless the device is restored(image restore)
to a point in time prior to accepting the Windows 11 upgrade *and not* accepting
the Window 11 upgrade. 
Related…I’ve seen Windows 10 22H2 devices(recently an HP All-in-one) that meet
Windows 11 specs where the user has accepted the Windows 11 ‘pushed offer/ready
etc.’ and the update continues to fail(and keeps trying). Latest drivers and
UEFI/BIOS installed. The usual DISM Check/Scan/Restore and Component clean up
indicate no problems, SFC doesn’t help, and System Restore was reset to Off(or
the users had not turned it on). The user finally baced kup their data, then
reinstalled Windows 10 22H2. 
…w
%40BYAPR05MB6552.namprd05.prod.outlook.com
